title: EastEnders SPOILER: Chantelle Atkins breaks down in tears after devastating miscarriage
text:
On Tuesday it was revealed that she had suffered a tragic miscarriage after visiting the hospital following worrying symptoms.

And in emotional scenes set to air on Thursday night, Chantelle Atkins will break down in tears after the loss of her unborn baby.

Following the aftermath of her tragedy, the episode will see her struggle with hiding the sad news from her husband Gary.

EastEnders SPOILER: Chantelle Atkins breaks down in tears after devastating miscarriage and is consoled by mother Karen Taylor

After Ash confirmed she had a miscarriage on Tuesday's episode, the hairdresser felt unable to tell Gary and pleaded with her friend to keep it a secret for now.

While she had tried to open up to Gary about what had happened, she couldn't bring herself to do so when he said how happy he was.

The guilt she feels about keeping quiet becomes a little too much for Chantelle, as she breaks down while telling her mother Karen Taylor what had happened.

Difficult time: Following the aftermath of her tragedy, the episode will see her struggle with hiding the sad news from her husband Gary

In the heartbreaking images, Chantelle is seen seeking solace with Karen, who hugs her as she cries into her shoulder.

Showing her support for her daughter, Karen embraced her lovingly as she sobbed about her tragic loss.

Gary has been very vocal about his desire to become a father again, and given his past history with violent behaviour it seems understandable that she doesn't want to tell him about the miscarriage.

But will Chantelle decide to tell him? Or will he find out some other way?

Jessica joined the soap earlier this year after she starred in 2017 film How To Talk To Girls At Parties starring Elle Fanning and Nicole Kidman.

She said: 'Just like the majority of the UK, I grew up watching EastEnders.

'It's an absolute honour to be joining the cast with all my childhood favourites... Rickaaaaaaaay.'

The soap's senior executive producer Kate Oates said Chantelle's 'picture-perfect' life could lead to conflict in the family.

EastEnders continues October 24, on BBC One at 7:30pm.
